gurmukhi: ਫੂਲ ਮਾਲ ਹੁਅੈ ਮਾਤ ੳੁਰ ਸੋਭੇ ਸਭੇ ਸੁਧਾਰ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Phool Maal Huai Maat Ur Sobhe Sabhe Sudhaar||12||
translation: Became a garland the neck of the goddess (the universal mother), bedecking it.12.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਤੇ ਦਾਨਵੋ ਬਾਨ ਪਾਨੀ ਚਲਾੲੇ || ਤਿਤੇ ਦੇਵਤਾ ਅਾਪ ਕਾਟੇ ਬਚਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Jite Daanvo Baan Paanoo Chadhaae|| Tite Devtaa Aap Kaate Bachaae||
translation: All the shafts shot by the demons with their hands, were intercepted by the goddess to protect herself.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਢਾਲ ਢਾਹੇ ਕਿਤੇ ਪਾਸ ਪੇਲੇ || ਭਰੇ ਬਸਤ੍ਰ ਲੋਹੂ ਜਨੋ ਫਾਗ ਖੇਲੇ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Kite Dhaal Dhaahe Kite Paas Pele|| Bhare Bastra Lohoo Lano Phaag Khele||13||
translation: Many were thrown on the ground with her shield and many were entrapped within the baited trap. The clothes saturated with blood created an illusion of Holi.13.

gurmukhi: ਦ੍ਰੁਗਾ ਹੂੰ ਕੀਯੰ ਖੇਤ ਧੁੰਕੇ ਨਗਾਰੇ || ਕਰੰ ਪਟਿ ਸੰਪਰਘ ਪਾਸੀ ਸੰਭਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Drougad Hoon Kooyan Khet Dhounke Nagdare|| Karan Pattee Sanparagh Paasoo Sanbhdare||
translation: The trumpets sounded and Durga began to wage war. She had pattas, axes and baits in her hands;

gurmukhi: ਤਹਾਂ ਗੋਫਨੈ ਗੁਰਜ ਗੋਲੇ ਸੰਭਾਰੇ || ਹਠੀ ਮਾਰ ਹੀ ਮਾਰ ਕੈ ਕੈ ਪੁਕਾਰੇ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Tahaan Gophnai Gurj Gole Sanbhdare|| Hathoo Maar Hoo Maar Kai Kai Poukdare||14||
translation: She caught of pellet bow, mace and pellets. The persistent warriors were shouting “Kill, Kill”.14.

gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਅਸਟ ਅਸਟਾ ਹਥਿਯਾਰੰ ਸੰਭਾਰੇ || ਸਿਰੰ ਦਾਨਵੇਂਦ੍ਰਾਨ ਕੇ ਤਾਕਿ ਝਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Tahai Ast Astaa Hathiyaaran Sanbhdare|| Siran Daanvendraan Ke Taak(i) Jhdare||
translation: The goddess held eight weapons in her eitht hands, and hit them on the heads of chief demons.

gurmukhi: ਬਬੱਕਿਯੋ ਬਲੀ ਸਿੰਘ ਜੁਧੰ ਮਝਾਰੰ || ਕਰੇ ਖੰਡ ਖੰਡੰ ਸੁ ਜੋਧਾ ਅਪਾਰੰ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Babakkiyo Badoo Singh Judhan Majhaaran|| Dare Khanndkhanndan Su Jodhaa Apaaran||15||
translation: The demon-king rored like a lion in the battlefield, and chopped into bits, many great warriors.15.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਦਾਨਵ ਰੋਸ ਭਰੇ ਸਬ ਹੀ || ਜਗਮਾਤ ਕੇ ਬਾਣ ਲਗੇ ਜਬ ਹੀ ||
transliteration: Tah Daanav Ros Bhare Sab Hoo|| Jagmaat Ke Baan Lage Jab Hoo||
translation: All the demons were filled with anger, when the were pierced by the arrows of the Mother of the worls.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਬਧਾਯੁਧੁ ਲੈ ਸੁ ਬਲੀ ਹਰਖੇ || ਘਨ ਬੂੰਦਨ ਜਿੳੁ ਬਿਸਖੰ ਬਰਖੇ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Bibadhaayudh(u) Lai Su Badoo Harkhe|| Ghan Boondan Jio Bisakhannddbarkhe||16||
translation: Those brave warriors caught hold of their weapons with pleasure, and began to shoot arrows like the rain-drops.16.

gurmukhi: ਜਨੁ ਘੋਰ ਕੈ ਸਿਅਾਮ ਘਟਾ ਘੁਮਡੀ || ਅਸੁਰੇਸ ਅਨੀ ਕਨਿ ਤਿੳੁਂ ੳੁਮਡੀ ||
transliteration: Jan(u) Ghor Kai Siaam Ghataa Ghoumdoo Asures Anoo Kan(i) Tioun Oumdoo||
translation: Like the roaring and advancing dark clouds, the forces of the demon-king marched forward.

gurmukhi: ਜਗਮਾਤ ਬਿਰੂਥਨਿ ਮੋ ਧਸਿ ਕੈ || ਧਨੁ ਸਾੲਿਕ ਹਾਥ ਗਹਿਓ ਹਸਿ ਕੈ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Jagmaat Biroothan(i) Mo Dhas(i) Kai|| Dhan(u) Saaik Haath Gadio Has(i) Kai||17||
translation: The Mother of the world, penetrating into the armies of the enemy, She caught hold of the bow and arrows smilingly.17.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ਕੁੰਜਰ ਪੁੰਜ ਗਿਰਾੲਿ ਦੀੲੇ || ੲਿਕ ਖੰਡ ਅਖੰਡ ਦੁਖੰਡ ਕੀੲੇ ||
transliteration: Ran Kounjar Pounj Giraae Dooe|| Ik Khanndakhanndddoukhanndkooe||
translation: She overthrew in the battlefield the herds of elephants, and chopped into halves some of them.
